pageTitle: Itinerary for Sunday, September 17, 2017 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Itinerary for the Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, for Sunday, September 17, 2017:

Ottawa, Ontario

7:20 a.m. The Prime Minister will participate in the Army Run and will deliver brief remarks.

Corner of Elgin Street and Laurier Avenue West

  • Media should arrive no later than 6:45 a.m.
  • Open coverage for remarks at 7:20 a.m. and photo opportunity for the race at 8:00 a.m.

Antigonish, Nova Scotia

2:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend a Celebration of Life for the Honourable Allan J. MacEachen, P.C., O.C., and will deliver remarks.

Charles V. Keating Millenium Centre
1100 Convocation Boulevard, St. Francis Xavier University

  • Media should present themselves at the entrance no later than 1:15 p.m.
  • Open coverage for remarks

Montréal, Quebec

6:15 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend a Global Progress Summit dinner with business leaders.

Closed to media.

Media Appearance

  • An interview with the Prime Minister hosted by Lynn Burry will air on NTV’s Sunday news program at 6 p.m NST.

Note: all times local
